algorithm_technique: monotonic stack to find nearest smaller elements
problem_summary_simple: Find the largest rectangular area in a histogram represented by bar heights.
problem_summary_technical: Employ a monotonic increasing stack to efficiently determine the left and right boundaries for each bar to calculate max rectangle area.
key_insights: The core idea is that for any bar, the largest rectangle it can be part of is bounded by the nearest smaller bars to its left and right.
A monotonic stack (increasing heights) helps find these boundaries efficiently in a single pass.
When a bar is encountered that is shorter than the top of the stack, it signifies the right boundary for the popped bar(s).
